channel.title: Android Developer Tips
channel.description: Android Developer Tips is a YouTube channel that besides introducing open-source libraries and app development tips and tricks also interviews the Android community's active members and this podcast holds the audio file of those interviews. https://www.youtube.com/AndroidDeveloperTips/
channel.itunes:subtitle: Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Mohsen Mirhoseini
channel.itunes:summary: Android Developer Tips is a YouTube channel that besides introducing open-source libraries and app development tips and tricks also interviews the Android community's active members and this podcast holds the audio file of those interviews. https://www.youtube.com/AndroidDeveloperTips/

channel.googleplay:description: Android Developer Tips is a YouTube channel that besides introducing open-source libraries and app development tips and tricks also interviews the Android community's active members and this podcast holds the audio file of those interviews. https://www.youtube.com/AndroidDeveloperTips/

item.title: fun code(): A magazine for Kotlin developers
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: The “fun code()” magazine is a one-time publication about Kotlin, created by Kotlin developers for Kotlin developers, and I had the pleasure of being one of the contributors. It was released during KotlinConf 2024 and received significant attention. In this exciting episode, I had the opportunity to gather some of the key individuals involved in […]

item.title: Android interview — Alejandra Stamato (@astamatok)
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: Alejandra Stamato is an Android community active member who recently switched from being an Android Developer Relations Engineer at Google working in Compose text and architecture, to a product role as Android Technical Lead at HubSpot. In this friendly interview, she will share with us her story and career path. Link to the video on […]

item.title: Android development — The must-have Android Studio plugins
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: As an Android developer, it’s crucial to have powerful tools that make our development process easier. In this video, Ilyas Ipek joins me to share some of the most useful Android Studio plugins that you may find helpful. Link to the video on YouTube:https://youtu.be/2ZT_MtMNo8s Links and References ► Medium Article about Android Studio Plugins:https://medium.com/wereprotein/all-my-android-studio-plugins-b25012ed51f6 ► […]

item.title: Android development — Maestro, Android Modern UI Testing
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: Maestro is the simplest and most effective mobile UI testing framework. Maestro is built on learnings from its predecessors (Appium, Espresso, UIAutomator, XCTest) and allows you to easily define and test your Flows. In this episode, I’ve asked Zhanibek Marshal to join me and share his experience using this framework. Link to the video on […]

item.title: Android interview — Nicole Terc (@nicole_terc)
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: Nicole Terc is an Android community active member who last year had 3 talks at 3 different Droidcon events. She has recently joined the Dance Company as Software Engineering Lead and in this friendly interview, she will share with us her story and career path. item.title: Android interview — Philipp Lackner (@plcoding)
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: Philipp Lackner is an Android YouTuber currently focusing mostly on his channel and training Android developers at the industrial level and is one of the Android Community’s active members. Having a big number of followers he is a well-known face among the Android trainers who recently moved to Berlin! In this interview which happened during […]

item.title: Android interview — Ivan Morgillo (@hamen)
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: Ivan Morgillo is a freelance Android Developer currently working for Novoda, the co-host of Code with the Italians, and one of the Android Community’s active members. He is a well-known face in the Berlin Android meetup group who recently moved back to Italy!In this interview, you will learn more about his lifestyle, his ideas about […]

item.title: Android interview — Danny Preussler (@PreusslerBerlin)
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Mirhoseini
item.description: Danny Preussler is an Android Engineer at SoundCloud and an Android Community active member. He is well known for all the Droidcon Berlin opening sessions he hosted, and many talks around testing and TDD, and is also a well-known face in the Berlin Android meetup group.In this interview, you will learn more about his lifestyle, […]
